alert.note: Alert for Eastern Magic Valley; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 4:21PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Line of weak thunderstorms from Chubbuck to Rockland sweeping east into the southeast highlands through 500 PM MDT... At 418 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from American Falls Reservoir to 14 miles southwest of Rockland. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts to 30 mph, pea size hail, and occasional lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Difficult boating conditions on area lakes. Locations impacted include... Pocatello, American Falls, American Falls Reservoir, Chubbuck, Inkom, Rockland, Fort Hall Bannock Peak, Portneuf Gap, Fort Hall Bannock Creek Lodge, Pocatello Airport, Pauline, Mink Creek Pass, Hawkins Reservoir, Daniels Reservoir, Arbon, Sublett Reservoir, and Roy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Magic Valley; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region
